info.description:
Calendly’s API is [REST](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer)-based and has predictable resource-oriented URLs. It uses **JSON** for request and response bodies and standard HTTP methods, authentication, and response codes.
##### Authenticate with personal access tokens or OAuth 2.0 To access Calendly data through the API, you can authenticate with **personal access tokens** or **OAuth 2.0**. To learn more about these authentication methods and when and how to use them, see [Getting Started with the Calendly API](https://developer.calendly.com/getting-started).
info.title: Calendly API

owner.description: A link to the resource that owns this Scheduling Link (currently, this is always an Event Type)

owner_type.description: Resource type (currently, this is always EventType)

max_event_count.description: The max number of events that can be scheduled using this scheduling link.

owner.description: A link to the resource that owns this Scheduling Link (currently, this is always an Event Type)

owner_type.description: Resource type (currently, this is always EventType)

oauth2.description: Put the access token in the `Authorization: Bearer <TOKEN>` header

personal_access_token.description: Put the access token in the `Authorization: Bearer <TOKEN>` header

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the user

slug.description: The portion of URL for the user's scheduling page (where invitees book sessions), rendered in a human-readable format

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the user's Calendly landing page (that lists all the user's event types)

timezone.description: The time zone to use when presenting time to the user

avatar_url.description: The URL of the user's avatar (image)

created_at.description: The moment when the user's record was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment when the user's record was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

current_organization.description: A unique reference to the user's current organization

custom_questions.name: What would you like to discuss?

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the event type

name.description: The event type name (in human-readable format)

active.description: Indicates if the event is active or not.

slug.description: The portion of the event type's URL that identifies a specific web page (in a human-readable format)

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the user’s scheduling site where invitees book this event type

duration.description: The length of sessions booked with this event type

kind.description: Indicates if the event type is "solo" (belongs to an individual user) or "group"

pooling_type.description: Indicates if the event type is "round robin" (alternates between hosts) or "collective" (invitees pick a time when all participants are available) or "null" (the event type doesn’t consider the availability of a group participants)

type.description: Indicates if the event type is "AdhocEventType" (ad hoc event) or "StandardEventType" (standard event type)

color.description: The hexadecimal color value of the event type's scheduling page

created_at.description: The moment the event type was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment the event type was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

internal_note.description: Contents of a note that may be associated with the event type

description_plain.description: The event type's description (in non formatted text)

description_html.description: The event type's description (formatted with HTML)

secret.description: Indicates if the event type is hidden on the owner's main scheduling page

booking_method.description: Indicates if the event type is for a poll or an instant booking

deleted_at.description: The moment the event type was deleted (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z"). Since event types can be deleted but their scheduled events remain it's useful to fetch a deleted event type when you still require event type data for a scheduled event.

kind_description.description: A formatted description of the kind of event type.

admin_managed.description: Indicates if this event type is managed by an organization admin

Profile.description: The publicly visible profile of a User or a Team that's associated with the Event Type (note: some Event Types don't have profiles)
Profile.title: Profile

type.description: Indicates if the profile belongs to a "user" (individual) or "team"

name.description: Human-readable name for the profile of the user that's associated with the event type

owner.description: The unique reference to the user associated with the profile

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the resource

status.description: Indicates if the event is "active" or "canceled"

start_time.description: The moment the event was scheduled to start in UTC time (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").

end_time.description: The moment the event was scheduled to end in UTC time (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

event_type.description: The event type associated with this event

total.description: Total invitees for an event, including invitees that have canceled

active.description: Total invitees for an event that have not canceled

limit.description: Maximum number of active invitees that can book the event

created_at.description: The moment when the event was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment when the event was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

user.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the user

event_guests.description: Additional people added to an event by an invitee

CalendarEvent.description: Information about the calendar event from the calendar provider.
CalendarEvent.title: CalendarEvent

kind.description: Indicates the calendar provider the event belongs to.

external_id.description: the id provided from the calendar provider for this calendar event.

Cancellation.description: Provides data pertaining to the cancellation of the Event

canceled_by.description: Name of the person whom canceled

Invitee.description: An individual who has been invited to meet with a Calendly member
Invitee.title: Invitee

payment.terms: sample terms of payment (up to 1,024 characters)
sample terms of payment (up to 1,024 characters)

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the invitee

first_name.description: The first name of the invitee who booked the event when the event type is configured to use separate fields for first name and last name. Null when event type is configured to use a single field for name.

last_name.description: The last name of the invitee who booked the event when the event type is configured to use separate fields for first name and last name. Null when event type is configured to use a single field for name.

status.description: Indicates if the invitee is "active" or "canceled"

questions_and_answers.description: A collection of the invitee's responses to questions on the event booking confirmation form

timezone.description: Time zone to use when displaying time to the invitee

created_at.description: The moment when the event was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment when the event was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

text_reminder_number.description: The phone number to use when sending text (SMS) reminders

rescheduled.description: Indicates if this invitee has rescheduled. If `true`, a reference to the new Invitee instance is provided in the `new_invitee` field.

old_invitee.description: Reference to old Invitee instance that got rescheduled

new_invitee.description: Link to new invitee, after reschedule

cancel_url.description: Link to cancelling the event for the invitee

reschedule_url.description: Link to rescheduling the event for the invitee

routing_form_submission.description: Reference to a routing form submission that redirected the invitee to a booking page.

currency.description: The currency format that the payment is in.

terms.example: sample terms of payment (up to 1,024 characters)

successful.description: Indicates whether the payment was successfully processed

no_show.description: Provides data pertaining to the associated no show for the Invitee

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the no show

created_at.description: The moment when the no show was created

reconfirmation.description: Assuming reconfirmation is enabled for the event type, when reconfirmation is requested this object is present with a `created_at` that reflects when the reconfirmation notification was sent. Once the invitee has reconfirmed the `confirmed_at` attribute will change from `null` to a timestamp that reflects when they took action.

confirmed_at.description: When the Invitee confirmed their attendance.

Guest.title: Guest
Guest.description: An individual whom an invitee has invited to be a guest attendee to an event

plan.description: Active subscription plan or trial plan

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the organization was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the organization was created or updated.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the membership

role.description: The user's role in the organization

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the user

slug.description: The portion of URL for the user's scheduling page (where invitees book sessions), rendered in a human-readable format

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the user's Calendly landing page (that lists all the user's event types)

timezone.description: The time zone to use when presenting time to the user

avatar_url.description: The URL of the user's avatar (image)

created_at.description: The moment when the user's record was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment when the user's record was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

organization.description: A unique reference to the organization

updated_at.description: The moment when the membership record was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

created_at.description: The moment when the membership record was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the organization invitation

organization.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the organization

email.description: The email address of the person who was invited to join the organization

status.description: The status of the invitation ("pending", "accepted", or "declined")

created_at.description: The moment the invitation was created (e.g. “2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment the invitation was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

last_sent_at.description: The moment the invitation was last sent (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

user.description: When the invitation is accepted, a reference to the user who accepted the invitation

event.description: The event that caused the webhook to fire

created_at.description: The moment when the event was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

created_by.description: The user who created the webhook

payload.description:
The payload for the webhook event. The data in the payload depends on the event.

For example, an `invitee.*` event produces an `Invitee` object in the payload.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the webhook

callback_url.description: The callback URL to use when the event is triggered

created_at.description: The moment when the webhook subscription was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

updated_at.description: The moment when the webhook subscription was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")

retry_started_at.description: The date and time the webhook subscription is retried

state.description: Indicates if the webhook subscription is "active" or "disabled"

events.description: A list of events to which the webhook is subscribed

scope.description: The scope of the webhook subscription

organization.description: The URI of the organization that's associated with the webhook subscription

user.description: The URI of the user that's associated with the webhook subscription

creator.description: The URI of the user who created the webhook subscription

InviteeNoShow.title: InviteeNoShow
InviteeNoShow.description: Information about an invitees no show.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the no show

invitee.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the associated Invitee

created_at.description: The moment when the no show was created

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the routing form.

organization.description: The URI of the organization that's associated with the routing form.

name.description: The routing form name (in human-readable format).

status.description: Indicates if the form is in "draft" or "published" status.

questions.description: An ordered collection of Routing Form non-deleted questions.

created_at.description: The moment the routing form was created.

updated_at.description: The moment when the routing form was last updated.

RoutingFormSubmission.title: Routing Form Submission
RoutingFormSubmission.description: Information about a Routing Form Submission.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the routing form submission.

routing_form.description: The URI of the routing form that's associated with the submission.

questions_and_answers.description: All Routing Form Submission questions with answers.

submitter.description: The reference to the Invitee resource when routing form submission results in a scheduled meeting.

submitter_type.description: Type of the respondent resource that submitted the form and scheduled a meeting.

created_at.description: The moment the routing form was submitted.

updated_at.description: The moment when the routing form submission was last updated.

EventTypeAvailableTime.description: An available meeting time slot for the given event type
EventTypeAvailableTime.title: Event Type Available Time

status.description: Indicates that the open time slot is "available"

invitees_remaining.description: Total remaining invitees for this available time. For Group Event Type, more than one invitee can book in this available time. For all other Event Types, only one invitee can book in this available time.

start_time.description: The moment the event was scheduled to start in UTC time

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the user’s scheduling site where invitees book this event type

UserBusyTime.title: User Busy Time
UserBusyTime.description: An internal or external scheduled event for a given user

type.description: Indicates whether the scheduled event is internal or external

start_time.description: The start time of the scheduled event in UTC time

end_time.description: The end time of the scheduled event in UTC time

buffered_start_time.description: The start time of the calendly event, as calculated by any "before" buffer set by the user

buffered_end_time.description: The end time of the calendly event, as calculated by any "after" buffer set by the user

uri.description: The uri associated with the calendly scheduled event

AvailabilitySchedule.title: User Availability Schedule
AvailabilitySchedule.description: The availability schedule set by the user.

uri.description: A URI reference to this Availability Schedule.

default.description: This is the default Availability Schedule in use.

name.description: The name of this Availability Schedule.

user.description: A URI reference to a User.

timezone.description: The timezone for which this Availability Schedule is originated in.

rules.description: The rules of this Availability Schedule.

AvailabilityRule.title: Availability Rule
AvailabilityRule.description: The rules for an availability schedule.

type.description: The type of this Availability Rule; can be "wday" or a specific "date".

intervals.description: The intervals to be applied to this Rule. Each interval represents when booking a meeting is allowed. If the interval array is empty, then there is no booking availability for that day. Time is in 24h format (i.e. "17:30") and local to the timezone in the Availability Schedule.

wday.description: The day of the week for which this Rule should be applied to.

date.description: A specific date in the future that this should be applied to (i.e. "2030-12-31").

PERMISSION_DENIED.description: Caller not authorized to perform this action

enum: You do not have permission to access this resource.
The server could not find the requested resource.

value.title: Resource Not Found
value.message: The server could not find the requested resource.

UNKNOWN.description: An error has occurred on the server

enum: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

ALREADY_EXISTS.description: Attempt to create a resource that already exists

Count.name: count
Count.description: The number of rows to return

PageToken.name: page_token
PageToken.description: The token to pass to get the next or previous portion of the collection

User.name: user
User.description: A URI reference to a user
